attributes.comment:
The wait time for adopting from China has increased to 18 months and it appears
as though the wait time will continue to rise. Since the biometrics (fingerprints) is
only valid for 12 months and the I-171H is only valid for 18 months, this means that
families must renew their fingerprints and their I-171H at least once and in more
and more cases twice. With the cost of an adoption from China hovering at
$20,000 any additional fees become an undo burden on these families. If you
decide that an increase is absolutely necessary and there are no other options,
please consider increasing the fingerprint and I-171H validity to 24 months and/or
increasing the adoption tax credit to offset the cost of the corresponding fee
increase.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Tina Powis-Dow
